metadata.title: CVE-2018-18503 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
When JavaScript is used to create and manipulate an audio buffer, a potentially exploitable crash may occur because of a compartment mismatch in some situations. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 65.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2018-18503` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 65.0+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-geckodriver - 65.0+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 65.0+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '65.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
